categories.name: Basics
categories.description: Learn the core building blocks of JavaScript including variables, constants, data types, operators, and the basic rules of writing code.

cards.title: const
cards.description: Declare a constant variable that cannot be reassigned.

cards.title: let
cards.description: Declare a variable that can be reassigned.

cards.title: Primitive Data Types
cards.description: Store a single value in a variable.

content.title: String
content.description: A sequence of characters.

content.title: Number
content.description: Integer or a floating-point number.

content.title: Boolean
content.description: True or false value.

content.title: Null
content.description: Intentional absence of a value.

content.title: Undefined
content.description: A variable without a value.

content.title: Symbol
content.description: Unique identifier.

content.title: BigInt
content.description: Greater then what the number type handles.

cards.title: Reference Data Types
cards.description: Store a reference to the location where the data is.

content.title: Arrays
content.description: Data structure that holds multiple values.

content.title: Functions
content.description: Reusable pieces of code that perform tasks.

content.title: Objects
content.description: Comma seperated lists of key-value pairs.

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.description: Basic math operators.

content.title: Modulus
content.description: Get the division remainder.

content.title: Exponentiation
content.description: Return the result of the first value to the power of the second.

content.title: Increment
content.description: Add 1 to a value.

content.title: Decrement
content.description: Subtract 1 from a value.

content.title: Concatenetion
content.description: Put 2 or more strings together.

cards.title: Assignment Operators
cards.description: Do something to the value then assign it to a variable.

content.title: Value Assignment
content.description: Simply assigning a value to a variable.

content.title: Addition Assignment
content.description: Adds the amount on the right side.

content.title: Subtraction Assignment
content.description: Subtracts the amount on the right side.

content.title: Multiplication Assignment
content.description: Multiplies the amount on the right side.

content.title: Division Assignment
content.description: Divides the amount on the right side.

content.title: Modulo Assignment
content.description: Gets the raminder of the amount on the right side.

content.title: Exponentiation Assignment
content.description: Gets the exponent of the amount on the right side.

cards.title: Comparison Operators
cards.description: Used to compare values.

content.title: Equal To
content.description: Checks just the value.

content.title: Equal Value & Type
content.description: Checks the value and the type.

content.title: Not Equal To
content.description: Checks just the value.

content.title: Not Equal Value & Type
content.description: Checks the value and the type.

content.title: Greater Than
content.description: Check if the value is bigger.

content.title: Less Than
content.description: Check if the value is smaller.

content.title: Greater Than or Equal
content.description: Check if the value is bigger or the same.

content.title: Less Than or Equal
content.description: Check if the value is smaller or the same.

cards.title: Console
cards.description: Used to display errors and test code.

content.title: console.log();
content.description: Output a message to the console.

content.title: console.error();
content.description: Makes the text red.

content.title: console.warn();
content.description: Makes the text yellow.

cards.title: Shortcuts
cards.description: Used to type code quicker.

content.title: shift + up/down
content.description: Highlight lines of code up and down.

content.title: shift + right/left
content.description: Highlight code right and left.

content.title: ctrl + right/left
content.description: Move cursor to beginning/end of line.

content.title: ctrl + up/down
content.description: Move cursor to beginning/end of file.

content.title: alt + up/down
content.description: Move line up/down.

content.title: shift + alt + up/down
content.description: Copy line up/down.

content.title: ctrl + /
content.description: Comment out a line of code.

content.title: ctrl + shift + /
content.description: Comment out multiple lines of code.

content.title: ctrl + d
content.description: Select the next instance of the selected word.

content.title: ctrl + shift + l
content.description: Select all instances of the selected word.

content.title: ctrl + shift + f
content.description: Search for a string in the project.

content.title: ctrl + shift + o
content.description: Search for a file in the project.

cards.title: Comments
cards.description: Lines of code that won't run

categories.name: Arrays
categories.description: Store and organize multiple values in a single variable, with methods to search, sort, add, or remove items.

cards.title: Creating an Array
cards.description: Arrays are created inside variables.

cards.title: Access by Index
cards.description: Arrays are zero based.

cards.title: Mixed Values
cards.description: Arrays can have any kinds of values.

cards.title: Nesting
cards.description: Arrays can be nested inside each other.

cards.title: Array Iteration
cards.description: Use loops or array methods to run code on each element.

cards.title: Array Methods
cards.description: Different methods to manipulate the arrays.

content.title: Static Vs Non Static
content.description: Static methods require the 'Array' keyword in front of it, non static methods are applied directly to the array

content.title: .length
content.description: A property that returns the length of the array.

content.title: .push()
content.description: Adds to the end of the array (Non Static).

content.title: .pop()
content.description: Removes the last item in the array (Non static).

content.title: .unshift()
content.description: Adds to the beginning of the array (Non static).

content.title: .shift()
content.description: Remove from the beginning of the array (Non static).

content.title: .reverse()
content.description: Exactly that (Non static).

content.title: .includes()
content.description: Returns true if the array has the passed value (Non static).

content.title: .indexOf()
content.description: Returns the index for the passed value (Non static).

content.title: .join()
content.description: Returns the elements as a string with a separator (Non static).

content.title: .slice()
content.description: Extracts a part of the array without affecting the original, end is not a part of sliced part (Non static).

content.title: .splice()
content.description: Directly modifies the array by adding, removing, and changing the elements (Non static).

content.title: .concat()
content.description: Combine with another array (Non static).

content.title: .flat()
content.description: Removes the brackets from nested arrays, 'Infinity' to remove from all levels (Non static).

content.title: .isArray()
content.description: Check if something is an array (Static).

content.title: .from()
content.description: Convert an array like object into an array (Static).

content.title: .of()
content.description: Create an array from a variable number of arguments (Static).

content.title: .forEach()
content.description: Used to apply code to each element in the array (Non static).

content.title: .filter()
content.description: Returns an array of items that meet the condition that is passed (Non static).

content.title: .map()
content.description: Returns an array that is the result of a function called on each element (Non static).

content.title: .reduce()
content.description: Reduces the array to a single value by running a function on each element (Non static).

content.title: .find()
content.description: Returns the first element that matches a condition (Non static).

content.title: .findIndex()
content.description: Returns the index of the first element that matches a condition (Non static).

content.title: .some()
content.description: Returns true if at least one element meets the condition (Non static).

content.title: .every()
content.description: Returns true if all elements meet the condition (Non static).

content.title: .sort()
content.description: Sorts the array in place, modifying the original (Non static).

content.title: .toString()
content.description: Converts the array into a comma-separated string (Non static).

content.title: .fill()
content.description: Fills all or part of the array with a static value (Non static).

content.title: .at()
content.description: Returns the element at the given index, supporting negative indexes (Non static).

content.title: .fromAsync()
content.description: Creates an array from an async source, like an async iterable (Static).

content.title: .toReversed()
content.description: Returns a reversed copy of the array without mutating the original (Non static, ES2023).

content.title: .toSorted()
content.description: Returns a sorted copy of the array without mutating the original (Non static, ES2023).

content.title: .toSpliced()
content.description: Returns a copy of the array with elements added or removed, without mutating the original (Non static, ES2023).

content.title: .copyWithin()
content.description: Copies a section of the array to another location within the same array (Mutates).

content.title: .entries()
content.description: Returns an iterator with key/value pairs for each index (Non static).

content.title: .keys()
content.description: Returns an iterator with the keys (indexes) of the array (Non static).

content.title: .values()
content.description: Returns an iterator with the values of the array (Non static).

content.title: .flatMap()
content.description: Maps each element and flattens the result one level (Non static).

cards.title: Spread
cards.description: Used to combine multiple arrays into a new one

cards.title: Destructuring
cards.description: Extract values from arrays into separate variables.

categories.name: Objects
categories.description: Create collections of related data and functionality using key-value pairs, useful for modeling real-world entities.

cards.title: Creating an Object
cards.description: Objects store data in key-value pairs. Keys are also called properties.

cards.title: Accessing Properties
cards.description: Access with dot or bracket notation.

cards.title: Nested Objects
cards.description: Objects can contain other objects or arrays.
cards.syntax: const user = { name: 'Alice', address: { city: 'NY', zip: 10001 } };

cards.title: Adding & Modifying Properties
cards.description: Objects can be updated or expanded dynamically.

cards.title: Deleting Properties
cards.description: Remove properties using the delete keyword.

cards.title: Object Methods
cards.description: Different methods to manipulate the objects.

content.title: .keys()
content.description: Returns an array of the object's keys (Static).

content.title: .values()
content.description: Returns an array of the object's values (Static).

content.title: .entries()
content.description: Returns an array of key-value pairs (Static).

content.title: .assign()
content.description: Copies properties from one object to another (Static).

content.title: .freeze()
content.description: Prevents adding, removing, or changing properties (Static).

content.title: .seal()
content.description: Prevents adding or removing properties but allows changes to existing ones (Static).

content.title: .defineProperty()
content.description: Defines or modifies a property with control over enumerability, writability, or configurability (Static).

content.title: .hasOwn()
content.description: Checks if an object has a specific property (ES2022, Static).

content.title: .fromEntries()
content.description: Creates an object from an array of key-value pairs (Static).

content.title: .create()
content.description: Creates a new object using another object as its prototype (Static).

cards.title: Object Destructuring
cards.description: Extract specific properties into variables.

cards.title: Renaming During Destructuring
cards.description: Rename properties while destructuring.

cards.title: Default Values
cards.description: Set defaults if the property doesn't exist.

cards.title: Spread Operator
cards.description: Copy or merge objects.

cards.title: Rest Operator
cards.description: Group remaining properties into a new object.

cards.title: this Keyword
cards.description: Refers to the object that owns the method.

cards.title: Getters and Setters
cards.description: Allow defining computed or controlled property access.
cards.syntax: const obj = { get area() { return this.x * this.y; } };

cards.title: Object References
cards.description: Objects are assigned by reference, not by value.
cards.syntax: const a = { name: 'John' }; const b = a; b.name = 'Mike'; // a.name is now 'Mike'

categories.name: Conditionals
categories.description: Control the flow of your programs with if/else and switch statements, allowing your code to react to different conditions.

cards.title: if Statement
cards.description: Executes a block of code if the condition is true.

cards.title: if...else Statement
cards.description: Adds an alternative block of code if the condition is false.

cards.title: else if Statement
cards.description: Checks multiple conditions in sequence.

cards.title: Ternary Operator
cards.description: A shorthand way to write simple if...else statements.

cards.title: Switch Statement
cards.description: Checks multiple possible values of an expression and runs the matching case.

cards.title: Logical Operators
cards.description: Used to combine or invert conditions.

content.title: && (AND)
content.description: True only if both conditions are true.

content.title: || (OR)
content.description: True if at least one condition is true.

content.title: ! (NOT)
content.description: Inverts the truth value of a condition.

cards.title: Nullish Coalescing Operator (??)
cards.description: Returns the right-hand value only if the left-hand is null or undefined.

cards.title: Optional Chaining (?.)
cards.description: Safely access deeply nested properties without throwing errors.

cards.title: Short-Circuit Evaluation
cards.description: Uses logical operators to set defaults or conditionally execute code.

categories.name: Loops
categories.description: Loops repeatedly execute code as long as a condition is met, allowing automation and iteration through data structures like arrays or objects.

cards.title: for Loop
cards.description: Runs a block of code a specific number of times.

cards.title: while Loop
cards.description: Runs as long as the condition is true.

cards.title: do...while Loop
cards.description: Runs the block once before checking the condition.

cards.title: for...of Loop
cards.description: Iterates over values of iterable objects like arrays, strings, or maps.

cards.title: for...in Loop
cards.description: Iterates over the keys (property names) of an object.

cards.title: Loop Control Statements
cards.description: Used to control or alter loop execution.

content.title: break
content.description: Immediately exits the loop.

content.title: continue
content.description: Skips the current iteration and continues to the next.

cards.title: Nested Loops
cards.description: Loops inside other loops, often used for multi-dimensional data.

cards.title: Iterating Arrays with Loops
cards.description: Common looping patterns used with arrays.

content.title: Standard for Loop
content.syntax: for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) console.log(arr[i]);

cards.title: Looping Over Strings
cards.description: Strings are iterable, allowing you to loop over each character.

cards.title: Infinite Loops (⚠️)
cards.description: Loops without a proper stopping condition can run forever and freeze the program.

categories.name: Functions
categories.description: Write reusable pieces of code that accept input, perform tasks, and return results, making programs more efficient.

categories.name: String
categories.description: Work with text using methods for searching, slicing, replacing, and formatting content.

categories.name: Number
categories.description: Handle numeric values, perform calculations, round results, and convert between different number types.

categories.name: Math
categories.description: Use JavaScript's Math object for advanced calculations, random number generation, and mathematical constants.

categories.name: Date & Time
categories.description: Manage and manipulate dates, times, and durations using the Date object and related methods.

categories.name: DOM & Events
categories.description: Dynamically update webpages and respond to user interactions through the Document Object Model and event handling.

categories.name: Web API
categories.description: Extend JavaScript with browser-provided tools like LocalStorage, Fetch, Canvas, and Geolocation.

categories.name: JSON
categories.description: Structure, store, and exchange data in a lightweight, human-readable format widely used in web development.

categories.name: ES6+
categories.description: Take advantage of modern JavaScript features such as arrow functions, template literals, classes, and modules.

categories.name: Fetch & Promises
categories.description: Retrieve data from APIs, work with asynchronous code, and handle responses and errors smoothly.

categories.name: Error & Debugging
categories.description: Find and fix problems in your code using debugging tools, error handling techniques, and best practices.
